Package com.game.Characters

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
com.game.Utilities.Position
com.game.Characters.Character
com.game.Characters.Enemy
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bear, FailedExam, ZombieProfessor
public class Enemy extends Character
Represents an enemy character within the game.

This class extends the Character class, specializing it for enemy behavior. Enemies can automatically navigate towards the player character, checking for collisions and initiating actions based on their AI logic. The Enemy class provides mechanisms for setting default positions, handling images, custom collision detection, and defining enemy-specific actions such as movement patterns and interactions with the player.

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(int speed, MainGamePanel gamePanel)
      Constructs an Enemy with specified speed and associates it with a game panel.
      Parameters:
      speed - the movement speed of the enemy
      gamePanel - the game panel the enemy belongs to

  • Method Details

    • setDefaultPosition

      protected void setDefaultPosition()
      Sets the default position and orientation of the enemy character. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses for custom positioning.
      Specified by:
      setDefaultPosition in class Character

    • getImage

      public void getImage()
      Loads the image resources for the enemy character. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses to specify enemy appearance.
      Specified by:
      getImage in class Character

    • checkCollision

      public void checkCollision()
      Checks for and handles collisions specific to the enemy character. This includes interactions with tiles, the player, and other characters.
      Overrides:
      checkCollision in class Character

    • setAction

      public void setAction()
      Determines and initiates the enemy's actions based on its AI logic. Actions may include pathfinding towards the player or random movement.
      Overrides:
      setAction in class Character

    • update

      public boolean update()
      Updates the enemy's state and handles movement based on the current direction.

      This method manages collision detection, action decisions, and movement execution. It ensures that the enemy navigates the game world according to its AI behavior.
